Erythemal effective UV irradiances: 0,3 W/m2 (total), 0,15 W/m2 (wavelength range 250-320 nm), 0,15 W/m2 (wavelength range 320-400 nm). The limits are same as in the European standard EN 60335-2-27 for UV type 3.
- For UV1 devices : 0.15W/m^2 UVA and 0.0005W/m^2 UVB   - For UV3 devices : 0.15W/m^2 (UVA and UVB)
This is set out under the Low Voltage Directive by the Department of Jobs, Enterprise and Innovation
For cosmetic purposes: UV type 3 according to the European Standard EN 60335-2-27, i.e. limits of effective irradiance (eryhtemal) are: UVB = 0,15 W/m2 and  UVA =0,15 W/m2.

Requirement to perform measurements of UV radiants (lamps) even when the lamp is replaced to check for compliance of stated UV limit, requirement for following tanning times stated for different skin types
